enter_exit_h.intro_Txt: The Enter/Exit detector page provides tools to define a virtual area that the camera should trigger an alarm if for example an object has entered or exited.
enter_exit_h.ptz_preset_Txt: To setup the Enter/Exit detector, define the below configuration options as required.
enter_exit_h.remove_ptz_preset_Txt: To remove a detector configuration, select it in the drop-down list and click Remove.
enter_exit_h.define_Txt1: Area of interest - This is a virtual area that is defined to detect moving objects entering a defined area and may trigger a camera to generate an action. To define a new area of interest, place the mouse pointer inside the video image, drag to create a shape on the area of interest and release the mouse. Note that, it is possible to define only 1 area of interest.
enter_exit_h.define_Txt2: Object size - Defines the size of the objects to be detected. The product will detect any object whose size falls within the minimum (blue rectangle) and maximum (white rectangle) range.
enter_exit_h.define_Txt3: Exclude area - This is a virtual area that is defined whenever it is required to mask a part of an area of interest to avoid unwanted triggering of camera action. It is defined when swaying objects such trees or flags are inside the area of interest. To define a new exclude area, place the mouse pointer inside the video image, drag to create a rectangle and release the mouse. Note that, it is possible to define a maximum of 4 exclude areas.
enter_exit_h.sensitivity_Txt: Sensitivity - Use this slidebar to define how sensitive the detection should be.
enter_exit_h.drawingOpacity_Txt: Drawing Opacity - Use this slidebar to define how transparent the area of interest shape should be. Note that, this change will not be saved.
enter_exit_h.removeShape_Txt: To remove the area of interest, click Remove shapes.

fence_h.intro_Txt: The fence detector page provides tools to define a virtual line that will detect objects that move across it, in this scenario, the Axis product will automatically trigger an event.
fence_h.ptz_preset_Txt: To setup the fence detector, define the below configuration options as required.
fence_h.remove_ptz_preset_Txt: To remove a detector configuration, select it in the drop-down list and click Remove.
fence_h.define_Txt1: Area of interest - This is a virtual line that is defined to detect objects moving across it and trigger a camera to generate an action. To define a new line, place the mouse pointer inside the video image, drag to create a shaped line and release the mouse. An area with red color will be created, Left and Right represent directions that an object might cross the line from. Note that, it is possible to define only 1 line..
fence_h.define_Txt2: Object size - Defines the size of the objects to be detected. The product will detect any object whose size falls within the minimum (blue rectangle) and maximum (white rectangle) range.
fence_h.define_Txt3: Exclude area - This is a virtual area that is defined whenever it is required to mask a part of an area of the line to avoid unwanted triggering of camera action. It is defined when swaying objects such trees or flags are inside the line of interest. To define a new exclude area, place the mouse pointer inside the video image, drag to create a rectangle and release the mouse. Note that, it is possible to define a maximum of 4 exclude areas.
fence_h.sensitivity_Txt: Sensitivity - Use this slidebar to define how sensitive the detection should be.
fence_h.drawingOpacity_Txt: Drawing Opacity - Use this slidebar to define how transparent the area of interest shape should be. Note that, this change will not be saved.
fence_h.removeShape_Txt: To remove the area of interest, click Remove shapes.

object_counter_h.intro_Txt: The object counter page provides tools to define a virtual line that will keep track of objects that move across it and provide a count.
object_counter_h.ptz_preset_Txt: To setup the object counter detector, define the below configuration options as required..
object_counter_h.remove_ptz_preset_Txt: To remove a detector configuration, select it in the drop-down list and click Remove.
object_counter_h.define_Txt1: Area of interest - This is a virtual line that is defined to detect objects moving across it and keep count. To define a new line, place the mouse pointer inside the video image, drag to create a shaped line and release the mouse. An area with red color will be created, Left and Right represent directions that an object might cross the line from. Note that, it is possible to define only 1 line.
object_counter_h.define_Txt2: Object size - Defines the size of the objects to be detected. The product will detect any object whose size falls within the minimum (blue rectangle) and maximum (white rectangle) range.
object_counter_h.define_Txt3: Exclude area - This is a virtual area that is defined whenever it is required to mask a part of an area of the line to avoid unwanted triggering of camera action. It is defined when swaying objects such trees or flags are inside the line of interest. To define a new exclude area, place the mouse pointer inside the video image, drag to create a rectangle and release the mouse. Note that, it is possible to define a maximum of 4 exclude areas.
object_counter_h.sensitivity_Txt: Sensitivity - Use this slidebar to define how sensitive the detection should be.
object_counter_h.drawingOpacity_Txt: Drawing Opacity - Use this slidebar to define how transparent the area of interest shape should be. Note that, this change will not be saved.
object_counter_h.removeShape_Txt: To remove the area of interest, click Remove shapes.

object_removal_h.intro_Txt: The object removed page provides tools to define a detection area around an object of interest, that the camera should trigger an alarm if for example that object has been removed.
object_removal_h.ptz_preset_Txt: To setup the object removed detector, define the below configuration options as required.
object_removal_h.remove_ptz_preset_Txt: To remove a detector configuration, select it in the drop-down list and click Remove.
object_removal_h.define_Txt1: Area of interest - This is a virtual area that is defined around an object to detect if that object has been removed from the scene and may trigger a camera to generate an action. To define a new area of interest, place the mouse pointer inside the video image, drag to create a shape around the object and release the mouse. Note that, it is possible to define only 1 area of interest.
object_removal_h.define_Txt2: Object size - Defines the size of the objects to be detected. The product will detect any object whose size falls within the minimum (blue rectangle) and maximum (white rectangle) range.
object_removal_h.define_Txt3: Exclude area - This is a virtual area that is defined whenever it is required to mask a part of an area of interest to avoid unwanted triggering of camera action. It is defined when swaying objects such trees or flags are inside the area of interest. . To define a new exclude area, place the mouse pointer inside the video image, drag to create a rectangle around the object and release the mouse. Note that, it is possible to define a maximum of 4 exclude areas.
object_removal_h.sensitivity_Txt: Sensitivity - Use this slidebar to define how sensitive the detection should be.
object_removal_h.drawingOpacity_Txt: Drawing Opacity - Use this slidebar to define how transparent the area of interest shape should be. Note that, this change will not be saved.
object_removal_h.removeShape_Txt: To remove the area of interest, click Remove shapes.
